column4: i'm having issues with a supposedly usb mass storage class device not persisting in /dev... the dmesg logs show detection and assignment to /dev/sdb 1 and 2, but when i try to mount it, cat it, or fdisk it, /dev/sdb doesn't exist... it assumes write through for drive caching, i have a feeling that has something to do with it... i've tried this with ubuntustudio and knoppix on x86, as well as xubuntu dapper on ppc with the same issues
mount /dev/sdb1 ?
and dmesg should say somehing if it lost device
i would love if it was that simple
any time i cat, fdisk, or mount /dev/sda1 or 2, i get device does not exist
that is, /dev/sdb
what does dmesg say? you could also try mount that usb by-uuid from /dev/disk/by-uuid/ or from /dev/disk/by-path/
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/61671/
^ dmesg
so reconnecting dosent work ?
no[e
nope*
before comment i dont see anyreason why it wouldnt work, but after trying to reconnect driver could be in somekind problem
can you rephrase that? i'm a bit confused
what it says after coonecting and trying to mount
nothing... when i try to mount it just says device doesn't exist
then i have noide
rats... this stupid issue has been bugging me for like 2 weeks now... and i really want it to work.... that multitracker is really cool....
usb is annoying sometimes. i dont see anything in that paste what would make it broken before line 25 ... after that reason is clear, but i think that isnt problem now
exactly... the most aggrivating part is that it works fine on windows, and other usb drives work fine on ubuntu
have googled known problems with that usbdrive name ?
hah i can't find a darn thing about it with linux... it's a zoom hd16 multitracker
